User Story: As a developer, I want to toggle the DevTools panel with a keyboard shortcut so that I can quickly access debugging tools.
Acceptance Criteria: The main `DevToolsPanel` can be toggled visible/hidden using the Ctrl+Shift+D keyboard shortcut in development environments.

User Story: As a developer, I want to collapse and expand sections in the DevTools panel so that I can focus on relevant information.
Acceptance Criteria: Individual sections within the panel (e.g., State Inspector, AI Debugger) can be collapsed and expanded.

User Story: As a developer, I want debug-only components with visibility toggles so that I can control which debugging tools are displayed.
Acceptance Criteria: DevTools components are only rendered and included in the build when the application is run in a development environment (`NODE_ENV === 'development'`).\nIndividual debugging components can be toggled visible/hidden within the DevTools panel.\nComponent visibility state persists across page refreshes.

User Story: As a developer, I want to view the complete application state so that I can understand the current system status.
Acceptance Criteria: The `StateInspector` section displays the current application state (e.g., from Redux or Context).\nThe state is displayed in a readable format (e.g., using a `JsonViewer`).\nState data is refreshed automatically when it changes.

User Story: As a developer, I want basic state modification capabilities so that I can test different state scenarios.
Acceptance Criteria: Basic state values (strings, numbers, booleans) can be modified directly through the DevTools UI.\nChanges to state values are reflected immediately in the application.\nState modification history is tracked and displayed.
